intro: Galium sylvaticum var. pyrenaicum, commonly known as the Pyrenean bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are slender and often reddish in color. This variety is adapted to rocky and acidic soils, commonly found in alpine and subalpine habitats.
